title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 December 2012 - XWiki
content:

09:28 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki

09:32 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki

09:42 <vmassol> mflorea: my jenkins stuff is working! :)  
09:42 <mflorea> cool!  
09:42 <vmassol> I now know how to not send an email based on some condition  
09:44 <vmassol> btw I'm wondering if we should have a jira project for xwiki.org infra  
09:44 <vmassol> I think we should  
09:44 <vmassol> I wanted to open a jira for the "jenkins" component for this  
09:44 <vmassol> we already have XWIKIORG but it's limitating  
09:44 <vmassol> sending an email  
09:45 <mflorea> ok, XWIKIORG has been used for far for documentation  
09:45 <vmassol> the only question is whether XWIKIORG should be moved to this jira under a "xwikiorg" component or not  
09:46 <vmassol> I think it should  
09:46 <vmassol> we would have "xwiki.org", "myxwiki.org", "jenkins", etc  
09:46 <vmassol> I'm going to propose that  
09:47 <vmassol> actually users who want to request a new wiki on myxwiki.org should probably create a jira in there  
09:53 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <vmassol> tmortagne, mflorea, jvdrean, cjd: mail just sent, please reply ASAP so that I can start creating the jira  :)  
09:55 <vmassol> (I'd like to create a jira for my jenkins work ;))  
09:55 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <mflorea> ok  
10:07 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <vmassol> sburjan`: ping  
10:32 <vmassol> sburjan`: see skype  
11:13 <vmassol> tmortagne: should l10n also be in the new infra jira?  
11:13 <vmassol> I think it should  
11:16 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't see what it would not be there with all the other xwiki.org ecosystem  
11:16 <tmortagne> s/what/why/  
11:16 <vmassol> ok we agree  
11:24 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <jvdrean> has quit  
11:33 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:39 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
12:07 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:10 <sburjan> vmassol: are you sure it's on to move XALOCALIZATION to XINFRA ?  
12:10 <vmassol> sburjan: what's your worry?  
12:10 <sburjan> IMO one is about the code bundled in XWiki, other is about the infrastructure aspect  
12:10 <vmassol> XALOCALIZATION is about l10n.xwiki.org  
12:11 <vmassol> not code  
12:11 <vmassol> code is XWIKI in "internationalization" component  
12:11 <sburjan> I agree, l10n is part of infra, but there is 2 aspects: one is the actual server that hosts l10n, and other is the software component (translations)  
12:11 <vmassol> no  
12:11 <vmassol> again anything related to code for i18n is in the XWiki platform jira  
12:12 <sburjan> yes, but adding translations values to a already existing key isn't supposed to be reported on XLOCALIZATION ?  
12:13 <vmassol> adding translations is l10n  
12:13 <sburjan> When you need a new key you report it on XWIKI, then you need a key translated to other language you report it to XALOCALIZATION  
12:13 <vmassol> adding new keys is XWIKI Platform  
12:13 <sburjan> exactly  
12:14 <sburjan> but I'm not talking about adding new key, I am talking about adding values for other languages to an existing key  
12:14 <vmassol> basically exporting l10n content to the code should be an XWIKI platform issue  
12:14 <vmassol> exceptwe don't explicitly create those issues since we do this all the time as part of the release process  
12:14 <vmassol> creating new translations is l10n  
12:15 <vmassol> but  
12:15 <sburjan> yes, I know. My only fear is that users will be confused about this. Creating a project on XINFRA to add new values for other languages doesn't make much logic (at least for me)  
12:15 <vmassol> users don't need to create issues to create new translations  
12:15 <vmassol> they shouldn't create any issue  
12:15 <vmassol> !!!!  
12:15 <vmassol> why would they need to?  
12:15 <sburjan> because maybe they don't know how to add values on l10n  
12:16 <vmassol> so you say they should use jira as a chat tool? :)  
12:16 <vmassol> they can if they want but it's not the right chat tool  
12:16 <vmassol> mailing lists and IRC are better  
12:16 <sburjan> well for example I reported some issues on XALOCALIZATION :)  
12:16 <sburjan> asking devs or somebody to add some french keys  
12:16 <vmassol> that's ok you can  
12:16 <vmassol> and you still can  
12:21 <msmeria> vmassol: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8549 this issue doesn't have an assignee  
12:23 <vmassol> thanks fixed  
12:48 <msmeria> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8462 this issue still reproduces on 4.3.1/ie8  
12:52 <vmassol> Enygma`: the comment is for you: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8462  
13:00 <vmassol> sburjan: just learnt that you'll be on holiday soon (when?). Is it possible for you (or manuel) to test 4.4 ASAP before you go on holiday?  
13:00 <vmassol> lunch time here, bbiab  
13:26 <sburjan> vmassol: I'm busy with 4.3.1 today. Tomorrow and Friday I can test, yes.  
13:27 <sburjan> vmassol: starting with saturday until 6th january  
13:39 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <mflorea> has quit  
14:32 <sburjan> vmassol: XE migration is ok on all databases. Gonna test a little bit the XEM migration also at least on MySQL  
14:34 <sburjan> but I can't find the XEM xar for 3.1. Could someone help me with the URL from maven please ?  
14:35 <tmortagne> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-wiki-administrator/  
14:36 <sburjan> thanks tmortagne  
14:37 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <tmortagne> the names are: xwiki-enterprise-manager-wiki-administrator -> xwiki-manager-wiki-administrator -> xwiki-manager-ui-all  
14:44 <sburjan> yes, it's always confusing because we changed this 3 times already  
14:49 <tmortagne> more actually if you count the groupid change :)  
14:50 <tmortagne> used to be in com.xpn.xwiki  
15:15 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <mrvanes> has quit  
15:16 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
15:19 <sburjan> vmassol: this looks very suspect to me.  http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/4.4-milestone-1-SNAPSHOT/  
15:19 <sburjan> 4.4-milestone-1-SNAPSHOT ?  
15:21 <vmassol> it's ok  
15:21 <vmassol> sburjan  
15:22 <vmassol> marius and I are working on this branch  
15:22 <tmortagne> sburjan: that's http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Enterprise/job/xwiki-enterprise-4.4M1/  
15:22 <vmassol> see the email on the list  
15:22 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:22 <vmassol> guys FYI I'm going to update all jenkins job to use the same email configruation  
15:23 <vmassol> I've also sent a proposal on the list  
15:23 <sburjan> vmassol: Stopping the 4.4M1 release till tests are all passing ?  
15:23 <sburjan> Commando mode ? :)  
15:23 <vmassol> yes  
15:23 <vmassol> that one  
15:23 <sburjan> ok. You must be a green beret or something :)  
15:24 <tmortagne> vmassol: is there remaining flickering tests ? jenkins seems all blue on 4.4\*  
15:24 <vmassol> ok I made a mistake  
15:24 <vmassol> :)  
15:24 <vmassol> now all jobs are configured to send emails  
15:25 <vmassol> but some were not sending voluntarily  
15:25 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/4336996  
15:25 <vmassol> need to find those and configure them back to not send emails  
15:26 <vmassol> so  
15:26 <vmassol> fyi now all jobs will send emails and they won't send emails when there's a JVM crash  
15:26 <vmassol> but in this case they'll get some nice little badges in the UI ;)  
15:27 <tmortagne> vmassol: only JVM crash ? we'll get mail for network issues ?  
15:27 <vmassol> yes that's next step  
15:28 <tmortagne> ok  
15:28 <vmassol> but it's easy now  
15:28 <vmassol> I've set up the full infra  
15:30 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
15:37 <mrvanes> has quit  
15:40 <sburjan> tmortagne, vmassol : this is normal for postgreSQL, right ? Wrapped Exception: ERROR: CREATE DATABASE cannot run inside a transaction block  
15:42 <tmortagne> sburjan: yes that's the main issue for supporting multiwiki with pgsql  
15:42 <sburjan> ok, thanks. Just wanted to make sure it's normal  
15:42 <sburjan> normal = known  
15:43 <tmortagne> sburjan: it's listed in https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1960  
15:43 <sburjan> old school issue :) thanks  
15:44 <cjd> There's that and the fact that in order to switch databases in postgres you have to connect to another tcp socket  
15:44 <cjd> no setCatalog()  
15:45 <vmassol> meeting, bbl  
15:46 <cjd> I think there's code for Postgres support in XHS which is based on different schemas rather than different dbases  
15:46 <cjd> similar to the Oracle approach  
15:48 <tmortagne> added a summary of remaining issue(s) in the jira issue description, you can add more if you have  
15:50 <tmortagne> ( cjd )  
15:51 <cjd> the biggest issue IMO is we need a test  
15:51 <cjd> once there's a coherent test, no problem is insurmountable  
15:52 <cjd> maybe vmassol has turned me into a TDD advocate but that's how I approach big projects now  
15:53 <cjd> ahh yes, Method2 as described in my comment \*almost\* works  
15:54 <cjd> IIRC there's weirdness about how it does some insertions which mangles the subwiki stuff with main wiki stuff, I can't remember well.  
16:13 <sburjan> any idea if in Oracle user must be = to database name in order to work ?  
16:14 <tmortagne> sburjan: I think the user must be the same as the schema name yes  
16:14 <sburjan> ok, thanks. gonna create username workspacetemplate  
16:14 <tmortagne> should have been created by XWiki  
16:15 <tmortagne> you are not supposed to create users by hand  
16:15 <tmortagne> I tough you were asking for the main wiki  
16:15 <sburjan> tmortagne: well, oracle creates users, not databases.  
16:16 <sburjan> tmortagne: Maine wiki works, WorkspacesManage/Install fails  
16:16 <tmortagne> then it's a bug  
16:17 <sburjan> this is how I create the stuff on Oracle:  
16:17 <sburjan> grant all privileges to xwiki;  
16:17 <tmortagne> sburjan: in oracle you get a shema with the user (it's not databases)  
16:17 <tmortagne> so the main wiki is stored in the xwiki schema  
16:17 <sburjan> yes  
16:18 <sburjan> but does XWiki know that on oracle you have to create a schema for the user instead of creating a database (like on MySQL) ? that's the question  
16:19 <sburjan> gonna try with a 4.1.4  
16:21 <cjd> because  
16:21 <cjd> wait for it...  
16:21 <cjd> Oracle only supports one database per cluser  
16:21 <cjd> \*cluster  
16:21 <sburjan> I don;t even know if I have a cluster :)  
16:22 <sburjan> but I want to know if this sould be reported or not  
16:22 <cjd> maybe I'm using the wrong word but in postgresspeak, cluster means the actual db server  
16:22 <tmortagne> sburjan: XWiki use a special code when creating wiki for Oracle  
16:23 <tmortagne> so it's supposed to be done properly  
16:23 <sburjan> ok. checking on 4.1.4  
16:23 <tmortagne> and that code did not changed in a while  
16:23 <cjd> It (tries to) do the same thing on postgres but there's a weird case where selects end up selecting over all schemas instead of just the one you want and it blows up  
16:30 <tmortagne> if (DatabaseProduct.ORACLE == databaseProduct) {                stmt.execute("create user " + escapedSchema + " identified by " + escapedSchema);                stmt.execute("grant resource to " + escapedSchema);  
16:30 <sburjan> ok, 4.1.4 is also affected  
16:31 <tmortagne> https://gist.github.com/4337520  
16:31 <tmortagne> this is what XWiki does  
16:31 <tmortagne> so it seems to be pretty aware :)  
16:31 <sburjan> cool. thanks for the code :)  
16:31 <tmortagne> and this code is very old  
16:32 <sburjan> so I should report this as a blocker ?  
16:32 <sburjan> let me create a subwiki instead of installing workspaces  
16:32 <tmortagne> sburjan: we officially support Oracle, something standard does not work on Oracle so that sounds pretty blocker yes  
16:34 <sburjan> tmortagne: creating a Workspace works :)) so I might not have a cleaned oracle.  
16:35 <sburjan> let me start from 0 and make sure I don't have a workspace user/schema  
16:35 <tmortagne> sburjan: wiki manager is not supposed to care much if the database/schema already exists or not and workspaces is supposed to use wiki manager  
16:38 <sburjan> so user workspace template should \_NOT\_ be created apriori. I see  
16:38 <tmortagne> I don't understand what you mean  
16:40 <sburjan> so user workspace template should \_NOT\_ be created by the user manually. I will ensure it does not already exists from an older test  
16:40 <tmortagne> sburjan: why would the user create it ?  
16:41 <tmortagne> and again as I said wiki manager is supposed to support the fact that a schema already exists  
16:41 <tmortagne> so that should not break it  
16:42 <tmortagne> but maybe workspaces changed something  
16:42 <sburjan> ok, I know for a fact that this does not happen on WOrkspace, because I always get a stracktrace when workspace template already exists from a previous instalation  
16:42 <tmortagne> sburjan: getting a stack trace does not mean it failed  
16:43 <tmortagne> wiki manager indicate that it could not create the database and assume it's because it's already there  
16:43 <tmortagne> and continue  
16:43 <tmortagne> but it appear only in the log  
16:43 <tmortagne> so what do you get exactly ?  
16:44 <tmortagne> do you get an error in the UI ?  
16:44 <tmortagne> or just some log ?  
16:45 <sburjan> tmortagne: ok, I had a previous workspacetemplate user before, this is why I got the stack. Everything is ok now  
16:45 <sburjan> so false alarm regarding Oracle  
16:45 <tmortagne> ok  
16:46 <sburjan> my clearing script was not "complete" it did not dropped the workspacestemplate user schem, so I had an older  
16:56 <sburjan> tmortagne: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XEM-238 :(  
16:56 <sburjan> as me http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XEM-237  
17:00 <tmortagne> sburjan: you sure you don't have them in XE ?  
17:01 <sburjan> I only tested XEM  
17:01 <tmortagne> XEM does not trigger any dependency anymore except the plugin themself  
17:01 <tmortagne> so I don't understand how XEM could have them and not XE  
17:02 <tmortagne> also I don't have the duplicate ini 4.4 snapshot  
17:02 <tmortagne> on rome  
17:05 <tmortagne> sburjan: I just looked at XE war and the jdom duplicate is there actually so it does not come from XEM  
17:07 <tmortagne> but I don't understand why there iis a difference between 4.4 and 4.3.1 for rome, I tested on 4.4 and just did a cherry pick  
17:14 <tmortagne> looks like the cherry-pick was not complete for rome

19:11 <mflorea> thanks
